Martin Fowler's Bliki (ja)

RubyPloticus

Jun 19, 2006

http://martinfowler.com/bliki/RubyPloticus.html

//In my recent post on EvaluatingRuby I mentioned that a colleague had put together a web app with some fancy numerical graphs. Someone emailed to ask how he did that. I added my short answer, ploticus, to the original bliki entry, but that led to the question of how he interfaced ruby with ploticus?

å…ˆã”ã‚[[EvaluatingRuby]]ã‚’æŠ•ç¨¿ã—ãŸãŒã€ãã®ä¸­ã§ç§ã¯ã€ åŒåƒšãŒWebã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ³ã‚·ãƒ¼ãªæ•°å€¤ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã‚’çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã ã¨è¿°ã¹ãŸã€‚ ãã‚Œã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã€ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ã‚„ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã‹ã¨ã„ã†è³ªå•ã®ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’é ‚ã„ãŸã€‚ ç°¡å˜ãªç­”ãˆã¨ã—ã¦ã€ŒPloticusã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸã€ã¨å…ƒã®ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ã«è¿½è¨˜ã—ã¦ãŠã„ãŸã®ã ãŒã€ ä»Šåº¦ã¯ã€Rubyã¨Ploticusã‚’ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ã¤ãªã’ãŸã®ã‹ã¨ã„ã†ç–‘å•ãŒã§ã¦ãã‚‹ã€‚

//I actually ran into a similar problem myself recently as I wanted to use ploticus to graph some data for a personal project. The solution I came up with was actually very similar, if rather less refined, than the one my colleague used. As a result I thought I'd share it.

å®Ÿã¯ç§ã‚‚ã€æœ€è¿‘ã€åŒæ§˜ã®å•é¡Œã«å‡ºãã‚ã—ãŸã®ã ã€‚ å€‹äººçš„ãªãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã§ploticusã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•åŒ–ã—ãŸã„ã¨æ€ã£ã¦ã„ãŸã€‚ è§£æ±ºç­–ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€å…ˆã»ã©ã®åŒåƒšãŒä½¿ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ã¨ä¼¼ãŸã‚ˆã†ãªã‚‚ã®ã«ãªã£ãŸï¼ˆç§ã®ã»ã†ãŒæ´—ç·´ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ãªã„ã ã‚ã†ã‘ã©ï¼‰ã€‚ ãªã®ã§ã€ã“ã“ã§ãã®æƒ…å ±ã‚’å…±æœ‰ã—ãŸã„ã¨æ€ã†ã€‚

//First a caveat - this is literally something I knocked up one evening. It isn't intended to be robust, performant or otherwise enterprisey. It's just for some data I use for me, myself, and I.

æœ€åˆã«æ³¨æ„ã—ã¦ãŠãã“ã¨ï¼ˆæ–‡å­—é€šã‚Šã€Œæ³¨æ„ã€ã—ã¦æ¬²ã—ã„ã€‚ç§ãŒæœ¬å½“ã«ãƒãƒã£ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã ã‹ã‚‰ï¼‰ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã¯å …ç‰¢çš„ã€ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹çš„ã€ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚ºçš„ãªã‚‚ã®ã¯ä¸€åˆ‡è€ƒæ…®ã—ã¦ã„ãªã„ã€‚ å˜ã«ã€ç§ã®ã€ç§ã®ã€ï¼ˆä½•åº¦ã‚‚è¨€ã†ã‚ˆï¼‰ç§ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã«ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã ã‹ã‚‰ã ã€‚

//A sophisticated way to drive a C library like ploticus is to bind directly to the C API. Ruby makes this easy, so I'm told, but it's too much work for me (particularly if I want to be done before cocktail-hour). So my approach is to build a ploticus script and pipe it into ploticus. Ploticus can run by taking a script from standard input that controls what it does, so all I have to do is run ploticus within ruby and pipe commands into it. Roughly like this:

ploticusã®ã‚ˆã†ãªCãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã¨ãã«ã‚¤ã‚±ã¦ã‚‹ã‚„ã‚Šæ–¹ã¯ã€C APIã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ç›´æ¥ãƒã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã ã€‚ Rubyã§ã¯ã“ã‚Œã‚’ç°¡å˜ã«è¡Œã†ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹â€¦â€¦ã¨ç§ã‚‚èã„ãŸã€‚ ã ãŒã€ç§ã«ã¯é›£ã—ã„ã‚ˆï¼ˆãŠé…’ã®æ™‚é–“ã®å‰ã«çµ‚ã‚ã‚‰ã›ãªãã‚ƒã„ã‘ãªã„ã‚“ã ã£ãŸã‚‰ã€ãªãŠã•ã‚‰ç„¡ç†ï¼‰ã€‚ ãªã®ã§ç§ãŒã‚„ã£ãŸã®ã¯ã€ploticusã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’ä½œã£ã¦ã€ploticusã«æ¸¡ã™ã‚„ã‚Šæ–¹ã ã€‚ploticusã¯æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰å‘½ä»¤ã®æ›¸ã‹ã‚ŒãŸã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’å—ã‘å–ã£ã¦å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ ç§ãŒã‚„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯ã€rubyã§ploticusã‚’èµ·å‹•ã—ã¦ã€ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’æ¸¡ã—ã¦ã‚„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã ã€‚ ã ã„ãŸã„ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚

def generate script, outfile IO.popen("ploticus -png -o #{outfile} -stdin", 'w'){|p| p << script} end

//To build up the script, I like to get objects that can work in my terms, and produce the necessary ploticus stuff. If you have anything that uses the prefabs, then putting together something is easy. I wanted to do clustered bar graphs, like this, which requires a ploticus script.

ã“ã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã€ è‡ªåˆ†ã®è¨€è‘‰ã§å‹•ãã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚’æ‰‹ã«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ããŸã€‚ ãã—ã¦ã€å¿…è¦ãªploticusã®çµæœã‚’æ‰‹ã«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ããŸã€‚ ãƒ—ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ–å¼ãªã‚‚ã®ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã‚Œã°ã€ãã‚Œã‚’çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ã‚‹ã®ã¯ç°¡å˜ã ã€‚ [[ã“ã†ã„ã†æ„Ÿã˜ã®|http://ploticus.sourceforge.net/gallery/students.htm]] æ£’ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ãŒæ¬²ã—ã‹ã£ãŸã®ã ãŒã€ãŠã‚Œã«ã¯ploticusã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆãŒå¿…è¦ã ã£ãŸã€‚

//I built what I needed in three levels. At the lowest level is PloticusScripter, a class that builds up ploticus script commands. Here it is:

ç§ã¯å¿…è¦ãªã‚‚ã®ã‚’3ã¤ã®ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ã§ä½œã£ãŸã€‚ æœ€ä¸‹å±¤ã¯PloticusScripterã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯ploticusã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã ã€‚ ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

class PloticusScripter def initialize @procs = [] end def proc name result = PloticusProc.new name yield result @procs << result return result end def script result = "" @procs.each do |p| result << p.scriptoutput << "\n\n" end return result
end end class PloticusProc def initialize name @name = name @lines = [] end def scriptoutput return (["#proc " + @name] + @lines).join("\n") end def methodmissing name, *args, &proc line = name.tos + ": " line.tr!('', '.') args.each {|a| line << a.tos << " "} @lines << line end end

//As you see the scripter is just a list of proc commands (well they could be anything that responds to script_output - but I didn't need anything else yet). I can instantiate the scripter, call proc repeatedly to define my ploticus procs, then when I'm done call script to get the entire script for piping into ploticus.

ã”è¦§ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ã€PloticusScripterã¯procã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã§ã‚ã‚‹ ï¼ˆscript_outputã«åå¿œã™ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã§ã‚‚ã‚ˆã‹ã£ãŸãŒã€ãã®ã¨ãã¯å¿…è¦ãªã‹ã£ãŸï¼‰ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€ procãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ç¹°ã‚Šè¿”ã—å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—ã¦è‡ªåˆ†ã®ploticus procã‚’å®šç¾©ã—ã¦ã„ãã€ ã™ã¹ã¦ãŒçµ‚ã‚ã£ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã§ã€scriptãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—ã¦ã€ ã§ãã‚ãŒã£ãŸã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆã—ã¦ã€ploticusã«æŠ•ã’ã‚‹ã€‚

//The next level is something to build clustered bar graphs:

æ¬¡ã®ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ã¯æ£’ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ã‚‚ã®ã ã€‚

class PloticusClusterBar attraccessor :rows, :columnnames def initialize @rows = [] end def addrow label, data @rows << [label] + data end def getdata scripter scripter.proc("getdata") do |p| p.data generatedata end end def colors %w[red yellow blue green orange] end def clusters scripter columnnames.size.times do |i| scripter.proc("bars") do |p| p.lenfield i + 2 p.cluster i+1 , "/", columnnames.size p.color colors[i] p.hidezerobars 'yes' p.horizontalbars 'yes' p.legendlabel column_names[i] end
end end

def generate_data result = [] rows.each {|r| result << r.join(" ")} result << "\n" return result.join("\n")
end
end

//This allows me to build a graph with simple calls to add_row to add data rows. This makes it much more easy for me to build up the data for the graph.

add_rowãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿è¡Œã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã€ ç°¡å˜ã«ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã®å…ƒã¨ãªã‚‹ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚ˆã‚Šç°¡å˜ã«ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚

//To make a particular graph, I'll write a third class on top of that:

ç‰¹å®šã®ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€ ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®ä¸Šã«ä½ç½®ã™ã‚‹3ã¤ç›®ã®ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚

//#produces similar to ploticus example in ploticus/gallery/students.htm

ï¼ƒ[[ploticusã®ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã«ã‚ã‚‹ä¾‹|http://ploticus.sourceforge.net/gallery/students.htm]]ã¨åŒã˜ã‚ˆã†ãªã‚‚ã®ã‚’ä½œã‚‹

class StudentGrapher def initialize @ps = PloticusScripter.new @pcb = PloticusClusterBar.new end def run loaddata @pcb.getdata @ps areadef @pcb.clusters @ps
end def loaddata @pcb.columnnames = ['Exam A', 'Exam B', 'Exam C', 'Exam D'] @pcb.addrow '01001', [44, 45, 71, 89] @pcb.addrow '01002', [56, 44, 54, 36] @pcb.addrow '01003', [46, 63, 28, 87] @pcb.addrow '01004', [42, 28, 39, 49] @pcb.addrow '01005', [52, 74, 84, 66]
end def areadef @ps.proc("areadef") do |p| p.title "Example Student Data" p.yrange 0, 6 p.xrange 0, 100 p.xaxisstubs "inc 10" p.yaxisstubs "datafield=1" p.rectangle 1, 1, 6, 6 end end def generate outfile IO.popen("ploticus -png -o #{outfile} -stdin", 'w'){|p| p << script} end def script return @ps.script end

end

def run output = 'fooStudents.png' File.delete output if File.exists? output s = StudentGrapher.new s.run s.generate output end

//It's a very simple example, but it's a good illustration of what I call the Gateway pattern. The PloticusClusterBar class is the gateway with the perfect interface for what I want to do. I make it transform between that convenient interface and what the real output needs to be. The PloticusScripter class is another level of gateway. Even for a simple thing like this I find a design of composed objects like this a good way to go. Which may only say how my brain's got twisted over the years.

éå¸¸ã«ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ãªä¾‹ã ãŒã€ç§ãŒ[[Gatewayãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³|http://martinfowler.com/eaaCatalog/gateway.html]]ï¼ˆ[[ç¿»è¨³|http://capsctrl.que.jp/kdmsnr/wiki/PofEAA/?Gateway]]ï¼‰ã¨å‘¼ã‚“ã§ã„ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã®è‰¯ã„ä¾‹ã ã€‚ PloticusClusterBarã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã¯ã€ç§ãŒã‚„ã‚ŠãŸã„ã“ã¨ã¸ã®å®Œç’§ãªã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚’æŒã£ãŸã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¤ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚ ã“ã®ä¾¿åˆ©ãªã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‹ã‚‰å®Ÿéš›ã«å¿…è¦ã¨ã•ã‚Œã‚‹å‡ºåŠ›ã«å¤‰æ›ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ PloticusScripterã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã¯ã¾ãŸåˆ¥ã®ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ«ã®ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¤ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã€‚ ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ãªã‚‚ã®ã§ã‚‚ã€composed objectã‚’ç”¨ã„ãŸè¨­è¨ˆã¯æœ‰ç”¨ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã¨åˆ†ã‹ã£ãŸã€‚ é•·ã„é–“ã‹ã‘ã¦ç§ã®è„³ãŒã‚†ãŒã‚“ã ã ã‘ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œãªã„ã‘ã©ã€‚
